stlib.datatypes.spatial

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • stlib.datatypes.GeneralType
      • stlib.datatypes.spatial.Point
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<PointIF>, Spatial, GeneralTypeIF, PointIF

    public class Point
extends GeneralType
implements PointIF
    This class represents spatial objects of type 'Point'
    Author:
    Markus Fuessel

      • distance

        public double distance(PointIF otherPoint,
                       boolean useSphericalGeometry)
        Description copied from interface: PointIF
        Get the distance between this and the passed point.
        If this and the passed point are geographical points, then useSphericalGeometry should set to true to get the geographical distance. Otherwise euclidean distance is calculated and returned.
        Specified by:
        distance in interface PointIF
        Parameters:
        otherPoint - - the other point to which the distance is to be calculated
        useSphericalGeometry - - if true spherical geometry is used to calculate the distance in metres, otherwise euclidean distance is used
        Returns:
        euclidean or geographical distance, depends on parameter useSphericalGeometry

      • almostEqual

        public boolean almostEqual(PointIF otherPoint)
        Description copied from interface: PointIF
        Verify if this point and the passed one are almost equal. This means that the two points are considered the same if they differ only slightly.
        Specified by:
        almostEqual in interface PointIF
        Parameters:
        otherPoint - - the reference point with which to compare.
        Returns:
        true, the two points are equal, false otherwise
        See Also:
        GeneralHelper.almostEqual(double d1, double d2)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(PointIF otherPoint)
        Compare this point with the passed one. Lexicographical order is used to compare two points. First the x-coordinates of both points are compared. If these are equal, the y-coordinates of both points are compared.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<PointIF>
        Parameters:
        otherPoint - - the other point to compare
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)
